intro: Osbeckia myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Osbeckia myrtifolia typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. It is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
